edu.uri.wbl.tex_tronics.ble

Class BluetoothLeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • edu.uri.wbl.tex_tronics.ble.BluetoothLeService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class BluetoothLeService
extends android.app.Service
    This Service is responsible for serving as a generic abstraction layer between the user and the Android BLE API. This allows the user to quickly develop BLE enabled applications without having to learn the details of BLE and/or spend the time debugging the nuances of the BLE API. Once a component binds to this Service, it can interact with the desired BLE device via calls to the public methods made available by this Service. In order to receive information back from the BLE device, the caller must implement a BleUpdateReceiver. The BleUpdateReceiver will provide the caller with connection updates as well as data received from the desired BLE device.
    Version:
    1.0, 12/04/2017
    Author:
    Matthew Constant, Andrew Peltier, Nick Constant

      • getDevice

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getDevice(java.lang.String bluetoothDeviceAddress)
        This method returns the nearby device corresponding to the given Bluetooth Device Address.
        Parameters:
        bluetoothDeviceAddress - Nearby BLEDevice to retrieve
        Returns:
        Bluetooth Device of requested BLE device, or null if invalid address

      • getGatt

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt getGatt(java.lang.String bluetoothDeviceAddress)
        This method returns the GATT of the corresponding BLE device. The Device must already have been connected via a successful call to connect().
        Parameters:
        bluetoothDeviceAddress - BD_ADDR of connected BLE Device
        Returns:
        BluetoothGatt of BLE device, null if not connected

      • connect

        public void connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        This method sends a request to the BluetoothDevice to connect. The Caller must wait for a BLE Update (via the BleUpdateReceiver) to get a response from this request. If the device is already connected (contained in the mConnectedDevices HashMap), no update will be sent. NOTE: The Android BLE API has a known issue with the BluetoothDevice.connectGatt() method where the autoConnect parameter must be true for some devices, false for some and can be either true or false for all others. The only way to find out for the particular device (BT radio, not phone model) is to try one and then the other if the first fails.
        Parameters:
        device - The BLE device to connect to.

      • discoverServices

        public void discoverServices(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt)
        This method sends a request to the connected BLE device to discover its services. The Caller must wait for a BLE Update (via the BleUpdateReceiver) to get a response from this request. If the BLE device is not already connected (contained in the mConnectedDevices HashMap), no update will be sent.
        Parameters:
        gatt - The GATT to discover services from.

      • readCharacteristic

        public void readCharacteristic(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                               android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        This method requests to update the characteristic value from the specified GATT. The Caller must wait for a BLE Update (via the BleUpdateReceiver) to get a response from this request. If the BLE device is not already connected (contained in the mConnectedDevices HashMap), no update will be sent.
        Parameters:
        gatt - The GATT to update characteristic value from
        characteristic - The Characteristic containing the value

      • writeCharacteristic

        public void writeCharacteristic(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                                android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic,
                                byte[] value)
        This method tells the specified GATT that this device has changed the Characteristic's value. The Caller must wait for a BLE Update (via the BleUpdateReceiver) to get a response from this request. If the BLE device is not already connected (contained in the mConnectedDevices HashMap), no update will be sent.
        Parameters:
        gatt - The GATT to update
        characteristic - The Characteristic containing the value

      • enableNotify

        public void enableNotify(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                         android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        This method enables notifications (automatically reads characteristic when changed) on the specified characteristic. No response is generated from this request, however when this device is notified that the characteristic has been updated, it will send an update (via BLE Update Receiver).
        Parameters:
        gatt - The BLE device
        characteristic - The characteristic to be notified of

      • disableNotify

        public void disableNotify(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt,
                          android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        This method disables notifications for the specified characteristic. If not currently enabled, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        gatt - The BLE device
        characteristic - The characteristic to stop being notified from

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothGatt gatt)
        This method disconnects from the GATT specified. If the GATT is not currently connected, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        gatt - The BLE device

      • sendUpdate

        private void sendUpdate(BleUpdate update,
                        java.lang.String bluetoothDeviceAddress)
        This method generates the Update Packet to be sent to all listening BLE Update Receivers. This method should be used for all updates that do not require the listener to know the specific Characteristic (if applicable) being updated (for example, CONNECTED or possibly CHARACTERISTIC_WRITTEN).
        Parameters:
        update - The BleUpdate to be sent
        bluetoothDeviceAddress - The address of the corresponding device.

      • sendUpdate

        private void sendUpdate(BleUpdate update,
                        java.lang.String bluetoothDeviceAddress,
                        java.lang.String characteristicUuid,
                        byte[] value)
        This method generates the Update Packet to be sent to all listening BLE Update Receivers. This method should be used for all updates that require the listener to know the specific charactistic that is being updated (for example, CHARACTERISTIC_READ or CHARACTERISTIC_UPDATED).
        Parameters:
        update - The BleUpdate to be sent
        bluetoothDeviceAddress - The address of the corresponding BLE device.
        characteristicUuid - The Characteristic being updated
        value - The value of the characteristic
